definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: He had formerly been in business at Bristol, but failed in debt to a number of people, compounded, and went to America.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏他專心一志地做生意，在幾年中就賺到許多錢。

sentences.english: Yet Luanda is one of the world’s trickiest places to do business in.
sentences.chinese: 然而，羅安達是全球最難做生意的幾處地方之一。

sentences.english: Perhaps you can do business together.
sentences.chinese: 也許你們可以一起做生意。

sentences.english: She egged her husband on to save up some money and start his own business.
sentences.chinese: 她攛掇其丈夫攢錢自己開店做生意。

sentences.english: They have been yoked together in business since the end of the eighties.
sentences.chinese: 80年代末以來，他們一直合夥做生意。

sentences.english: Close shop to try and control monetization and you can only rely on your own internal innovation machine & capital.
sentences.chinese: 關起門來做生意，你只能依賴內部的創新和資本。

sentences.english: Let's do it in the way of business.
sentences.chinese: 這件事我們還是按做生意的老規矩辦吧。

sentences.english: And I know that like in Japan, they like to cultivate relationships first before they do business with one another,
sentences.chinese: 我知道，在日本，人們在做生意之前先經營彼此關係。

sentences.english: Plenty of Americans do bidness in China & you never hear them disappearing out of thin air.
sentences.chinese: 許多美國人在中國做生意，從來沒有聽說過他們失蹤。

sentences.english: There's no room for sentiment in business.
sentences.chinese: 做生意不能婆婆媽媽的感情用事。

sentences.english: Operating a business for the purpose of sex violates state law.
sentences.chinese: 靠性做生意賺錢與州法律是相違背的。

sentences.english: Being honest is what I have learned in business these years.
sentences.chinese: 誠信是我這幾年做生意的一得。

sentences.english: They stop freelancing when they earn enough money from their business.
sentences.chinese: 當他們掙夠了做生意的錢就停止自由創作了。

sentences.english: My husband's here on business, so I decided to tag along with him.
sentences.chinese: 我老公在這兒做生意，所以我就跟來了。

sentences.english: This in a way highlights the difficulty of foriegn companies doing business in China.
sentences.chinese: 這正說明了外企在中國做生意的艱難。

sentences.english: He could move his business from place to place and sell more "night lunches."
sentences.chinese: 他可以到處做生意，並且能賣出更多的夜宵。

definition: to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal
to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to act jointly/to form a partnership
